005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object;
007
008import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
009import java.util.Objects;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012
013/**
014 * Represents a date/time value which may not have a timezone making it
015 * ambiguous as a point in time.
016 */
017public class AmbiguousDateTime
018    extends AbstractAmbiguousTemporal<AmbiguousDateTime, ZonedDateTime> {
019
020  /**
021   * Construct a new date/time object. This type supports ambiguous dates/times
022   * that were provided without a time zone.
023   * <p>
024   * The date/time value will be ambiguous if the {@code hasTimeZone} is
025   * {@code false}.
026   *
027   * @param value
028   *          the date/time value
029   * @param hasTimeZone
030   *          {@code true} if the date/time is intended to have an associated time
031   *          zone or {@code false} otherwise
032   */
033  public AmbiguousDateTime(@NonNull ZonedDateTime value, boolean hasTimeZone) {
034    super(value, hasTimeZone);
035  }
036
037  @Override
038  public AmbiguousDateTime copy() {
039    return new AmbiguousDateTime(getValue(), hasTimeZone());
040  }
041
042  @Override
043  public int hashCode() {
044    return Objects.hash(getValue(), hasTimeZone());
045  }
046
047  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.OnlyOneReturn")
048  @Override
049  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
050    if (this == obj) {
051      return true;
052    }
053    if (!(obj instanceof AmbiguousDateTime)) {
054      return false;
055    }
056    AmbiguousDateTime other = (AmbiguousDateTime) obj;
057    return hasTimeZone() == other.hasTimeZone() && getValue().equals(other.getValue());
058  }
059}
